intro: Alkekengi pubescens, commonly known as the hairy autumn crocus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and striking red or orange flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. The plant produces distinctive, inflated seed pods that split open to release its seeds. Alkekengi pubescens is often found in woodland areas and along the edges of meadows, where it thrives in partial shade. Its ornamental value has made it a popular choice for garden cultivation in temperate climates.
